page.title: 16HISTORY
page.content: The area is fairly rich in historical buildings. In Wath there is a{lock-up, a stone two storey building which was used as temporary accommodation for drunks and trouble makers until they could be taken to Rotherham. It had two small windowless cells on the first floor, with the constables office above. It was last used in the mid-nineteenth century, and it is now derelict. Opposite this are the remains of the{Pinfold,}this circular structure was used to, keep stray animals of the village in. At {Brampton, the Hall}there was in danger of being razed to the ground in l979. It was discovered that inside were remains of oak panelling dating back to the 14th century. The timber is also interesting because it shows many carpenters marks.
